result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew C. Malone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Threaten Force, etc., a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(3).
  • Intimidate Victim/Threaten Force, etc., a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.

Defendant enters a plea of no contest to an amended Count 1 - Intimidate victim 940.45(3) and Count 2.  Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty as amended.  Joint recommendation for 1 years jail on Ct. 1 and 9 months consecutive on Ct. 2, fines, costs and DNA sample.  Defendant makes a statement.  Court accepts joint recommendation.
Subpoena for 7/7 & 8/2016 - Jury Trial

Atty White appears for the State.  Matthew Malone in the Courtroom in custody.  Atty Jansen appear by telephone.  Motions in limine discussed.  Atty Jansen is still working on his witness list.  Court states that it is due in one week form today.  No objection to having States witness (Child Advocay Worker) testifies via video, she now lives in Texas.  This jury trial will be held in July.

Attorney Bradley J Jansen appeared by phone means for Defendant Matthew C. Malone. Prosecuting Atty Catharine Denise White appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Bond reduction hearing.  Attorney Jansen makes a request for reduction.  Defendant has been in jail since Feb last year.  Few different attorneys, etc.  ADA White makes argument to leave his bond the same.  Bond modification denied.  Judge states multiple bail jumping charges, etc.
letter from defendant regarding bond - response from Judge Habeck - work with your attorney

Defendant Matthew C. Malone in court, in custody.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Bradley J Jansen appeared by phone means for Defendant Matthew C. Malone.   Motion in limine filed and motion for continuance emailed to Judge.  Original coming in the mail.  Atty Jansen new on the case and has not received discovery yet from previous attorneys.  Requesting more time to get ready for trial.  Granted.  Jury trial will be rescheduled.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Bradley Jensen

Status conference scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attny Ron Haacke advises the Court that the PD will be appointing counsel other then Attny Ritter because of the case type.  DA request a $10,000 cash bond with no contact.
